Description: Lower body fragment of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater. Bird, or griffin-bird, to right; preserved are one leg and the belly; below, added red bands on black. Interior glazed very shiny black with heavy wheelmarks.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit: 'Related to the Ptoon Painter; the drawing of the bird's right leg is the same as that on a bird on a handle plate, Louvre E 623 (ABV 83, 1; CVA France 19: pl.160 fig.2), attributed to the painter.'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 77, no. 255 pl. 57)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0951)
